1.text: The wicked flee when no man pursues: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

2.text: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.

3.text: A poor man that oppresses the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaves no food.

4.text: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.

5.text: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.

6.text: Better is the poor that walks in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

7.text: Whoever keeps the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shames his father.

8.text: He that by usury and unjust gain increases his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.

9.text: He that turns away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.

10.text: Whoever causes the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.

11.text: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that has understanding searches him out.

12.text: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.

13.text: He that covers his sins shall not prosper: but whoever confesses and forsakes them shall have mercy.

14.text: Happy is the man that fears always: but he that hardens his heart shall fall into mischief.

15.text: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.

16.text: The prince that wants understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hates covetousness shall prolong his days.

17.text: A man that does violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.

18.text: Whoever walks uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

19.text: He that tills his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that follows after vain persons shall have poverty enough.

20.text: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that makes haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

21.text: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

22.text: He that hastens to be rich has an evil eye, and considers not that poverty shall come on him.

23.text: He that rebukes a man afterwards shall find more favor than he that flatters with the tongue.

24.text: Whoever robs his father or his mother, and said, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.

25.text: He that is of a proud heart stirs up strife: but he that puts his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.

26.text: He that trusts in his own heart is a fool: but whoever walks wisely, he shall be delivered.

27.text: He that gives to the poor shall not lack: but he that hides his eyes shall have many a curse.

28.text: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
